intro: Phyllanthus glaziovii, commonly known as the Mexican waterleaf, is a shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, and it is adapted to thrive in dry, rocky environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and medicinal research.
